model
Class LogicComponentFactory

java.lang.Object
  model.LogicComponentFactory
public class LogicComponentFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Provides functionality for creating LogicComponent objects from a given type string.

Author:
Daniel Stahl, Kevin Wellwood

Method Summary
 LogicComponent buildComponent(java.lang.String type)
          Creates and returns a component of the type specified by a TYPE_STRING.

          Returns the default factory for building logic components.

buildComponent

public LogicComponent buildComponent(java.lang.String type,
                                     int x,
                                     int y)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Creates and returns a component of the type specified by a TYPE_STRING. The location must be in standard coordinates.

Parameters:
type - the component type
x - the x coordinate
y - the y coordinate
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

setDefaultGui

public static void setDefaultGui(Gui gui)
Sets the gui for the default factory. As a side effect, the default factory must be reinstantiated.

Parameters:
gui - the gui

setDefaultModel

public static void setDefaultModel(Model model)
Sets the model for the default factory. As a side effect, the default factory must be reinstantiated.

Parameters:
model - the model

getDefaultInstance

public static LogicComponentFactory getDefaultInstance()
Returns the default factory for building logic components.

Returns:
the factory

newInstance

public static LogicComponentFactory newInstance()
Returns a new factory for building logic components with the defaults for model and gui preset.

Returns:
the new factory
